intro: Homalium hondurense, commonly known as the Honduran holly, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
